Effects.Name: Bass
Effects.Description: Adjusts the level of the low-end frequencies on the wet signal. Adds lighter reverb to thicker, more bass-heavy sound.

Effects.Name: ModulationDepth
Effects.Description: Adds a pitch modulation to the wet signal.

Effects.Name: ModulationNoiseDepth
Effects.Description: Adjust the amount of sporadic modulation applied to the wet signal.

Effects.Name: Size
Effects.Description: Adjusts the size of the effect space.

Effects.Name: Control1
Effects.Description: Custom control 1 particular to reverb mode.

Effects.Name: Control2
Effects.Description: Custom control 2 particular to reverb mode.

Effects.Name: CurveFiltering
Effects.Description: Effect setting for Reverse mode.

Effects.Name: DelayCurveShape
Effects.Description: Effect setting for Reverse mode.

Effects.Name: Diffusion
Effects.Description: Adjusts the density of the reverb reflections. Lower settings produce a more distinct echo effect, while higher settings create a thicker, more enveloping reverb.

Effects.Name: DiffusionModulationDepth
Effects.Description: Effect setting for Hall mode.

Effects.Name: Distortion
Effects.Description: Adjusts the amount of grit on the wet signal, higher settings add fuzz

Effects.Name: DriveDwell
Effects.Description: Intensity dry signal hists the springs.

Effects.Name: EDome
Effects.Description: The cavernous E-DOME produces long reverb trails with a lovely smooth and lush modulation. Invoke the sound of massive arena settings!

Effects.Name: EchoVerb
Effects.Description: For those in need of simultaneous reverb and delay effects, the Echoverb engine provides a sprawling echo effect with huge, ambient repeats.

Effects.Name: EnvelopeGain
Effects.Description: Controls sensitivity of envelope.

Effects.Name: Hall
Effects.Description: Patterned after the lush sounds of studio rack units from the 80s, the Hall L engine is distinguished by its highly diffuse tones and blooming characteristic.

Effects.Name: LoFi
Effects.Description: Turns the lush and grandiose effect of reverb on its head and embraces destructive elements like distortion, oversaturation, and pitch fluctuation.

Effects.Name: MasterOffset
Effects.Description: Effect setting for Offspring mode.

Effects.Name: MasterPreDelay
Effects.Description: Effect setting for Offspring mode.

Effects.Name: MetalBox
Effects.Description: MetalBox captures the reverberations of a very small space with extremely reflective walls â€“ imagine your guitar amp in a metal cargo-shipping container.

Effects.Name: MetallicMix
Effects.Description: Effect setting for Plate mode.

Effects.Name: ModVerb
Effects.Description: This modulating effect revisits the earthy combination of tremolo and spring reverb found in many vintage guitar amplifiers.

Effects.Name: Offspring
Effects.Description: Nothing else sounds like the Offspring reverb. This dramatic effect falls between the sound of an angel's harp and a retro-futuristic sci-fi soundtrack.

Effects.Name: OutboardSpring
Effects.Description: Outboard Spring was inspired by the sound of intensely crafted outboard spring tanks. It's a sound sought after by surf rock guitarists from coast to coast.

Effects.Name: PitchShiftModulation
Effects.Description: Increase for more pronounced shimmer modulation.

Effects.Name: DelayReverbCrossfade
Effects.Description: Mix delay and reverb effect. Low values favor delay, high values favor reverb.

Effects.Name: PitchShiftNormalCrossfade
Effects.Description: Mix of normal and shimmer reverb. Increase to add more shimmer effect.

Effects.Name: Plate
Effects.Description: A meticulously crafted simulation of vintage plate reverb units for the 50s and 60. It replicates the beautiful audio blasting into the face of a metal sheet.

Effects.Name: PreDelay
Effects.Description: The delay time between the dry signal and the onset of the reverb.

Effects.Name: PreDelayFeedback
Effects.Description: Sets the amount of feedback applied to the pre-delay signal.

Effects.Name: PreDelayFeedbackHighCut
Effects.Description: Sets the pre-delay feedback high cutoff frequency.

Effects.Name: PreDelayFeedbackLowCut
Effects.Description: Effect setting for multiple modes.

Effects.Name: Quantize
Effects.Description: Effect setting for LoFi mode.

Effects.Name: Reverse
Effects.Description: Create chilling and dramatic backwards effects with this haunting reverb engine. Mix it with the dry signal for an unnerving shadow effect.

Effects.Name: ReverbEngine
Effects.Description: Applies a reverb effect to sound input, the Ventris Dual Reverb has two engines. Single and dual mode supported.

Effects.Name: Room
Effects.Description: Captures the ambient reverberations of a real acoustic space, from a warm and intimate household room to a larger theatre sized space.

Effects.Name: Shimmer
Effects.Description: This pitch shifting reverb engine mixes traditional room sounds with octave-up reflections for an angelic reverb effect.

Effects.Name: Swell
Effects.Description: Applies a volume swell effect to your instrument's dry signal, which is then fed into the reverb effect for amorphous clouds of sound.

Effects.Name: SwellTime
Effects.Description: Adjust length of volume swell. Short to long.

Effects.Name: Time
Effects.Description: Sets min and max delay times.

Effects.Name: TremoloDepth
Effects.Description: Depth of tremolo effect.

Effects.Name: TremoloRate
Effects.Description: Effect setting for ModVerb mode.

Effects.Name: TrueSpring
Effects.Description: An exceptionally realistic effect with the unmistakable drip heard in vintage spring reverb equipped amplifiers, by Source Audio's Scientist, Bob Chidlaw.

Effects.Name: Mix
Effects.Description: Controls the blend between dry and wet signal.

Effects.Name: Output
Effects.Description: Controls the output level of the effect.

Effects.Name: Treble
Effects.Description: Adjusts the level of the high-end frequencies on the wet signal.

Effects.Name: ModulationRate
Effects.Description: Controls the speed of modulation applied to the wet signal.

Effects.Name: PreDelayModulationDepth
Effects.Description: Controls modulation depth applied to the pre-delay signal.

Effects.Name: InputLowCutoff
Effects.Description: Sets the low frequency cutoff for the input signal.
